title: Region defined by y=1/SQRTx  part - b

content.description: Let R be the region in the first quadrant under the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39DB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for 4 ≤ x ≤ 9.
content.question: If the line x=k divides the region R into two regions of equal area, what is the value of k?

frqParts.text: If the line x=k divides the region R into two regions of equal area, what is the value of k?

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
